parts.text: Okay, I will recommend 3-5 valid UofT courses related to Chinese Culture Studies for a second or third-year student, verifying their existence in the 2024-2025 calendar and summarizing the descriptions. I will present the output as a JSON array.

  {
    "course_code": "EAS209H1",
    "course_name": "Approaches to East Asia",
    "course_description": "This course is required for East Asian Studies specialists and majors. It introduces different approaches, theories, and methodologies for studying East Asian societies and cultures, serving as a foundation for upper-level EAS courses. It should be taken as early as possible, preferably in the second year.",

    "course_rank": 1,

    "prerequisite_codes": [],

    "explanation": "An ideal course for understanding the philosophical underpinnings of Chinese culture."
  },
  {

    "course_name": "Environment and East Asia",
    "course_description": "This course introduces environmental issues that are important to East Asia and examines East Asia's role in the global environmental crisis, engaging with both the factual and humanities dimensions of climate change, biodiversity loss, and other environmental crises.",
    "prerequisite_codes": [],
    "course_rank": 3,
    "explanation": "Explores the intersection of environmental concerns and East Asian contexts."
  },

    "course_description": "Explores traditional Chinese political philosophy. Most courses will involve both lecture-based content and classroom discussion.",
    "prerequisite_codes": ["EAS105"],
    "course_rank": 4,
    "explanation": "For a deeper understanding of Chinese political thought; note the prerequisite."
  },

    "prerequisite_codes": [],

    "explanation": "While not exclusively focused on Chinese culture, it offers a broader perspective on science and its societal impact, which can be relevant to understanding cultural contexts."
